description.originalText: Yanitha has been caring for our now 3.5 yo son for the past year and we cannot recommend her highly enough! Our needs have changed with the arrival of our second child and we will be very sad to see her go. She is caring, conscientious, creative and very reliable. My son absolutely loves her and she is always coming up for fun activities for the two of them. She is never on her phone and she is always very engaged with him. An amazing cook, excellent artist, and incredibly organized partner in caring for our son, our loss is truly your gain.

description.displayText:
Yanitha has all the qualities of the very best caregivers: she is reliable, flexible, caring, responsible, easy-going, takes direction happily, is a clear and direct communicator, and "is the best babysitter in the whole wide multiverse!" (Direct quote from our 9 year old daughter :)
Yanitha has been caring for our two children for about 8 months. She manages pickup from school and after-school activities for our 4th grade daughter and cares for our toddler son two days a week while we work from home. (Grandma provides care for him the other 3 days/week.) Yanitha is a great cook, happy to help with meal preparation as necessary. She plays with our son and happily takes him on adventures to the various parks in the neighborhood, even ones that are pretty far away but worth the effort (e.g. sand play time!) Yanitha is great at managing our tween daughter's mood swings and is a fun but firm companion to our increasingly independent daughter. We hope she will return to us next fall!

description.displayText:
Yanitha is a wonderful nanny who our now-11 month old loves. She has made our lives manageable during this difficult time. She has been able to keep our baby entertained in the apartment and takes
them outside to different playgrounds for multiple hours every day, which we all love.

We are first-time parents and Yanitha has been flexible and accommodating of our wishes as we cope with the rapid changes in our baby's schedule and development. We use they/them
pronouns for the baby, which Yanitha has completely embraced and supported. She has nurtured them as they learn to eat solids and learn to walk, providing care and support and reporting back
to us on their progress. Yanitha encourages our child to explore and they have grown into a happy and adventurous baby in her care.
We feel very comfortable communicating with Yanitha and working out any concerns that we have. She has always told us about scheduling conflicts well in advance and has always been on time.
